author: Special Correspondent
text:
Nanotechnology has benefited all the areas such as environment science, food science, pharmaceutical, medical and industrial sciences and the research scholars should use the full potentials of Nanotechnology, said C. Swaminathan, Vice-Chancellor, Periyar University.

Inaugurating a workshop on Nanotechnology for biologists brought up by the Department of Zoology of Periyar University here, Mr. Swaminathan explained the various funding opportunities available in this field.

He stated that India remains 18th in nanotechnology research.

According to him the civilisation is classified based on the tools they use -- stone age, bronze age, and iron age.

Nano age

Presently we are in the technology age or the Nano age. The global demand for nano scale materials is increasing at an annual growth rate of 30.6 per cent and the market demand during 2015 is $ 1 trillion.

The Vice-Chancellor asked research scholars, and faculty of Periyar University to do research in the field of Nanotechnology. A. Bhattacharyya from Rajiv Gandhi Institute and Technology, Bengaluru; Pratima R. Solanki, Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi; Nooruddin Khan, University of Hyderabad; G. Sudarsanam, Sri Venkateswara University, Tirupati; spoke.
title: ‘More research needed in nanotechnology’
